page.title: 12Eaglesfield ClayPigeon Shoot
page.content: Clay pigeon shooting is a{sport}where people with shotguns aim to hit moving targets called clay pigeons, which are small discs of clay that shatter when hit. Each year a shoot is organised on farmland near Eaglesfield for the purpose of raising money, originally for the Gala but more recently for the {charity}known as The British Heart Foundation. Entries come from{Club}members throughout Cumbria and Dumfries and Galloway. Trophies and prizes are donated by local individuals and businesses.
